issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

resolution.description: A fix for this issue is checked into the tree and tested.
resolution.name: Fixed

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

fields.description:
Steps to reproduce:

a) create volume in cluster B (not co-located with CLC/OSG/WS)
b) create snapshot from that volume
c) when completed, try to create a volume in cluster A from that snapshot

*cloud-output.log* (attached complete logs)
{noformat}
2014-03-21 01:17:25 ERROR 000000616 NioServerHandler         | Internal Error: value
2014-03-21 01:17:25 DEBUG 000006205 request                  | Received error response: com.amazonaws.services.s3.model.AmazonS3Exception: Status Code: 400, AWS Service: null, AWS Request ID: null, AWS Error Code: null, AWS Error Message: null, S3 Extended Request ID: null
2014-03-21 01:17:25  WARN 000006205 SnapshotObjectOps        | Failed to downlaod snapshot from objectstorage: bucket=snapshots-29177215e7f14ba9a89c7366ecd501db, key=snap-25919d43
com.amazonaws.services.s3.model.AmazonS3Exception: Status Code: 400, AWS Service: Amazon S3, AWS Request ID: null, AWS Error Code: null, AWS Error Message: null, S3 Extended Request ID: null
        at com.amazonaws.http.AmazonHttpClient.handleErrorResponse(AmazonHttpClient.java:773)
        at com.amazonaws.http.AmazonHttpClient.executeHelper(AmazonHttpClient.java:417)
        at com.amazonaws.http.AmazonHttpClient.execute(AmazonHttpClient.java:229)
        at com.amazonaws.services.s3.AmazonS3Client.invoke(AmazonS3Client.java:3384)
        at com.amazonaws.services.s3.AmazonS3Client.getObject(AmazonS3Client.java:1093)
        at com.amazonaws.services.s3.AmazonS3Client$2.getS3ObjectStream(AmazonS3Client.java:1166)
        at com.amazonaws.services.s3.internal.ServiceUtils.retryableDownloadS3ObjectToFile(ServiceUtils.java:326)
        at com.amazonaws.services.s3.AmazonS3Client.getObject(AmazonS3Client.java:1162)
        at com.eucalyptus.blockstorage.SnapshotObjectOps.downloadSnapshot(SnapshotObjectOps.java:144)
        at com.eucalyptus.blockstorage.BlockStorageController$VolumeCreator.getSnapshot(BlockStorageController.java:1828)
        at com.eucalyptus.blockstorage.BlockStorageController$VolumeCreator.run(BlockStorageController.java:1615)
        at java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor.runWorker(ThreadPoolExecutor.java:1145)
        at java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor$Worker.run(ThreadPoolExecutor.java:615)
        at java.lang.Thread.run(Thread.java:744)
{noformat}

Storage properties for snapshot:
{noformat}
PROPERTY	PARTI00.storage.shouldtransfersnapshots	true
DESCRIPTION	PARTI00.storage.shouldtransfersnapshots	Should transfer snapshots
PROPERTY	PARTI01.storage.shouldtransfersnapshots	true
DESCRIPTION	PARTI01.storage.shouldtransfersnapshots	Should transfer snapshots

comments.body:
Logs around the failure. [~zhill], it looks like the request to download the snapshot made it through OSG to Walrus but there seems to be an error in the response path. I'll debug it further but just wanted to check if this was a failure related to the recent Walrus cleanup/changes you've been working with. 

[~mdshaonimran], Have you tested s3 operations such as PUTs and GETs with this setup (OSG and Walrus)? Did any of the operations fail?

{code}
